node.title: Patient left in emergency department for whole day before being moved to ward
node.description: A Palmerston North woman says a relative in her 80s waited almost a day in the city hospital's overcrowded emergency department until she was moved to a ward.

node.title: Hitting Putin where it hurts? How to sanction "a very rich man"
node.description: "From his standpoint, he's gotten away with everything," said one of Putin's most prominent critics, "and unless we can actually prove to him that we're serious, he'll think he can get away with it again."

node.title: Calls for mannequins to better reflect shoppers
node.description: Mannequin sizes and shapes have stayed relatively the same for hundreds of years. Despite some calling for more diversity, New Zealand's last mannequin maker says stores are reluctant to change. Audio

node.title: Sandy Hook mom says legal win means her son "helped create change"
node.description: Nicole Hockley's son was one of 20 first-graders and six educators murdered at Sandy Hook Elementary School in 2012.

node.title: Fire investigators look into cause of Cromwell blaze
node.description: A fire in a large commercial building in Cromwell, in Central Otago, has been extinguished overnight.

node.title: New report says sea levels will rise in the next 30 years as much as they did in the past century
node.description: That's according to several federal agencies, including the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

node.title: Rugby for the vaccinated and unvaccinated
node.description: New Zealand Rugby says there is space in the game for both vaccinated and unvaccinated players to play club rugby this season.

node.title: Reece Walsh is an 'elite talent' who needs to become an 'elite player'
node.description: Warriors coach Nathan Brown is optimistic the NRL club will have young fullback star Reece Walsh for some time to come.

node.title: Valieva wins women's short programme
node.description: Russian teenager Kamila Valieva dominated the Olympic ice on Tuesday night, finishing on top of the short programme standings.

node.title: Protesters outside Parliament 'disappointed' over no meeting with Cabinet ministers
node.description: A combined statement from groups of protesters at Parliament grounds says they are "disappointed" that a letter sent to the government on Monday asking for talks has been "ignored".

node.title: UK health agency says long Covid-19 less common in the vaccinated
node.description: Long Covid-19 is less likely to affect vaccinated people than unvaccinated people, a new review of 15 studies by the UK Health Security Agency released on Tuesday has concluded.

node.title: Rugby Championship to go ahead in 2022 with all four teams
node.description: SANZAAR intends to play a complete Rugby Championship this year spread across all four countries.

node.title: Disney says face masks now optional for vaccinated at theme parks
node.description: As virus counts fall, Coachella and Stagecoach music festivals drop COVID-19 requirements for April events.

node.title: Bob Saget's family seeks to block release of autopsy photos, video
node.description: His family says releasing the records would cause "extreme mental pain, anguish, and emotional distress."

node.title: Retail sales surge in January as Americans step up spending
node.description: Despite inflation and an ongoing pandemic, Americans appear ready to renew spending.

node.title: Veterans say VA wrongly denied disability claims related to base's water
node.description: A CBS News investigation found questions about the qualifications of "subject matter experts" who review VA claims.

node.title: Mudslides and torrential rains kill dozens in Brazil: "Horror scene"
node.description: The city of Petropolis was slammed by a deluge, and the mayor said the death toll could rise as searchers picked through the wreckage.

node.title: Son of a slave reflects on the lessons he learned from his father
node.description: Daniel Smith spoke with CBS News about his incredible story, which reflects the arc of race relations in America — from slavery to civil rights activism, and the fight to end systemic discrimination.

node.title: Mbappe gives PSG the edge over Real Madrid
node.description: Late Mbappe stunner gives PSG 1-0 home win over Real Madrid Late Mbappe stunner gives PSG 1-0 home win over Real Madrid Kylian Mbappe scored a stunning individual goal in...

node.title: Parliament protest: Still no sign of towing to remove blockade
node.description: There is still no sign of towing services to remove vehicles illegally parked or blocking the way near Parliament, where protesters are occupying the area for the ninth day.

node.title: Information warfare expert says U.S. is finally playing Russia at its own game
node.description: The head of an organization that's battled Russian disinformation in Ukraine for years tells CBS News the U.S. has finally learned to counter Putin's unique brand of hybrid warfare​.

node.title: Google to restrict apps from tracking you on Android devices
node.description: The move, following Apple's efforts to beef up privacy protections, is another blow for the digital ad business.

node.title: Putin gets a new card to play in standoff with the West over Ukraine
node.description: Russian lawmakers have formally requested that Putin recognize Ukraine's rebel-held breakaway regions. The U.S. has warned him against it.

node.title: Americans win gold and silver in men's freeski slopestyle
node.description: Hall and Goepper's one-two finish gives Team USA six medals in freestyle skiing, the most of any sport in this year's Winter Olympics so far.

node.title: Video shows hundreds of birds mysteriously fall from the sky
node.description: The cause of the sudden deadly swarm remains a mystery.

node.title: Watch Live: Los Angeles Rams celebrate Super Bowl victory with parade
node.description: The 1.1-mile victory parade is scheduled to start at 11 a.m. local time at the Shrine Auditorium and end at the L.A. Memorial Coliseum.

node.title: CNN executive Allison Gollust resigns after company investigation
node.description: The announcement comes nearly two weeks after CNN president Jeff Zucker resigned over an undisclosed "consensual relationship" with a colleague, later reported to be Gollust.

node.title: Prince Charles' charity being probed by U.K. police
node.description: The investigation involves claims that a Saudi businessman donated large sums to the charity with an eye on a royal honor and perhaps even U.K. citizenship.

node.title: Biden rejects Trump's efforts to shield White House visitor logs
node.description:
"The president has determined that an assertion of executive privilege is not in the best interests of the United
States," White House counsel Dana Remus wrote in a letter to David Ferriero, archivist of the United States.

node.title: Tyrese Gibson holds mom's hand for last time in emotional video
node.description: The "Fast and Furious" star's mother was in a coma amid an ongoing battle with COVID-19 and pneumonia.
